summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn today! In this incredible sermon on Psalm 23, PT breaks down three profound truths: 'The Lord is my shepherd, my supplier, and my savior.' Can you imagine having a God who not only provides for you but walks with you through every single valley of life? Pastor Travis shares deeply personal insights about how God meets our needs beyond just material things - He supplies supernatural peace, the ability to forgive, courage, and most importantly, His very presence. The most striking part? When he explains that valleys aren't punishments, but purposeful places where God strips away distractions to be intimately close to us. Using the powerful metaphor of sheep and their shepherd, PT reminds us that we're weak, prone to wandering, but God is always pursuing, protecting, and restoring us. His illustration about shadows being bigger than reality and that where there's a shadow, there's always light, is absolutely transformative. The sermon culminates with a powerful call to 'prophesy' - to speak life over our dead situations, recognizing that our words have incredible power to either kill or resurrect. Pastor Travis challenges us to stop complaining and start declaring God's promises over our lives. This message isn't just a sermon; it's a roadmap to understanding God's incredible, intimate care for each of us.
mainPoints: The Lord is my shepherd who provides complete protection
God is my supplier of both material and spiritual needs
Jesus is the savior who restores and revives my soul

versesMentioned.text: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, he refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his name's sake. Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me. You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. Surely your goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty. I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'
And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.

When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.
As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, my God.
The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'

Monday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's presence in my current challenges
Monday.action: Take time to list out current life challenges. Next to each challenge, write how God might be present or working in that situation, even if you can't see it yet.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see Your presence in my challenges. Give me eyes to recognize Your work, even when circumstances feel overwhelming. Teach me to trust Your process. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding that valleys are temporary passages, not permanent residences
Tuesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you feel stuck. Journal about how this might be a 'valley passage' and what lessons you can learn during this season.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me see my current challenges as passages, not permanent destinations. Give me Your perspective and wisdom to grow through this season. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 18:21: 'The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.'
Wednesday.action: For every negative thought or complaint, immediately replace it with a positive declaration or prayer. Practice intentional, life-giving speech.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me guard my mouth and speak words of life. Let my words align with Your promises and bring hope, not destruction. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 4:19: 'And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.'
Thursday.focus: Recognizing God as my ultimate provider
Thursday.action: Make a gratitude list of ways God has already provided for you, both materially and spiritually. Reflect on His faithfulness.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, thank You for being my perfect provider. Help me trust You completely and recognize Your provision in every area of my life. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Psalm 23:4: 'Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me.'
Friday.focus: Embracing God's presence in difficult seasons
Friday.action: Reach out to someone you know who is going through a difficult time. Offer genuine encouragement and prayer support.
Friday.prayer: God, use me as an instrument of Your comfort. Help me reflect Your presence to others who are walking through dark valleys. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.focus: Trusting God's transformative power in every situation
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal how He might be working in your current challenges for your ultimate good.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I trust Your process. Help me see beyond my current circumstances and believe in Your greater plan. Reveal Your purpose in my life. Amen.
